location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 278: Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, off Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter to Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, refers to Robinson's letter of 2 September (no. 108) and asks Robinson whether he detected any symptoms of opposition to the Agent at Sharjah, Hajee Yacoob [Hajji Yaqoob], during his visit to the Arabian coast. In addition, Kemball asks Robinson to acquaint him with any complaints that he may have received of the Agent allegedly misappropriating monies recovered as compensation in cases of piracy or maritime aggression.
